page.title: 06OAKHILL SCHOOL
page.content: Oakhill School was created in 1981 by the amalgamation of the village schools of Alderton and Dumbleton when the number of pupils in each school began to fall. So that each village would still retain a school the infant classes are based at Dumbleton and the junior classes at Alderton. The children are taken to the appropriate site by bus. There are two full-time teachers at each site and a part-time teacher who spends some time at each. The headteacher is based at Alderton but spends some time each week at the infant base. There are now 66 children at the combined schools and this attempt to save village schools has proved most successful. It has been possible to create support for one school within the two villages.
